intro: Ludia craggiana, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, tuberous roots. Ludia craggiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
